newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dlr ends firmer on late U.S. dlr selling.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dlr ends firmer on late U.S. dlr selling.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar reversed early weakness to end slightly firmer on Monday on late U.S. dollar selling from exporters, dealers said.
The local unit ended at T$27.497 against Saturday's T$27.505 close. Turnover through dealers was an active US$248.5 million.

The strong U.S. dollar in overseas markets weakened the local dollar but U.S. dollar selling by exporters at month-end was heavy, dealers said. "I don't expect major movements in the rate because demand and supply are quite balanced," said one dealer. A T$27.49-T$27.51 range was seen for Tuesday.
